The government must ensure balanced media coverage to prevent disadvantage and bias from arising in the public domain.

Media analysis should be done before such debates are sanctioned on TV, not only to help protect the image of participants but also to preserve credibility for future shows.

Prime-time TV debates are common events in the United S a t e s , Western European countries, Australia and other democratic settings.

In contrast, a case study of Saluran Suria in the last 10 months – since Sept 30, 2004 – shows the channel has posted a dismal CV of four live TV debates. Why? Because our media covered such debates as it would a fish-and-chips crowd, ignoring almost all other key factors.
